chargeHist.descr: Possession of THC - 2nd and Subsequent Offense

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dyllon M. Tag was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

42 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation

22CM333 was ordered dismissed and read in.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

ADDRESS INFO for Dyllon M. Tag
Current: 3136 Craig Road, Eau Claire, WI 54701 United States  (Effective: 08-09-2022)
Prior: 508 Vine Street, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States

3:27 PM Cases called: 22CF618 & 22CM333. Defendant Dyllon M. Tag in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Dyllon M. Tag. 

22CF618: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Information mirroring the criminal complaint will be filed. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1 in 22CF618: Possession of Methamphetamine as a repeater. Priors as related to this charge, are acknowledged. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders: 
2 years Probation sentence withheld with conditions.

Conditions of Probation
9 months jail with Huber all stayed pending further order of the court
Apply to Eau Claire County Treatment Court and if accepted, successfully complete treatment court.
Maintain absolute sobriety
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
court costs and surcharges

Contraband is ordered destroyed. Anything else in 22CF618 and all of 22CM333 is ordered dismissed and read in. 
20 days in which to appeal. 

42 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation.
